This is pretty experimental work.  The python "parser" (basically no parsing) means there are strong contraints on code.  Each new line must yeild complete code statement...  


```{r setup, include = F}

library(reticulate)
```

---

Define some functions:

```{python}
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris

def remove_units(df):
    df.columns = pd.Index(map(lambda x: x.replace(" (cm)", ""), df.columns))
    return df

def length_times_width(df):
    df['sepal length*width'] = df['sepal length'] * df['sepal width']
    df['petal length*width'] = df['petal length'] * df['petal width']
```

And we'll use `left_assign` next.

---




`r chunk_reveal("iris", lang = "python", left_assign = T)`


```{python iris}
xobject = load_iris()
xobject = pd.DataFrame(xobject.data,columns=xobject.feature_names)
xobject.pipe(remove_units).pipe(length_times_width)
```
